ELECTIONS

ELECTIONS
![cr=w_814,h_407](https://sainthedwigcity.com/revize_photo_gallery/Election/cr=w_814,h_407.jpg?t=202305062214590)
**Saint Hedwig General Election
May 2, 2026
to elect Mayor, City Council Place 2 and City Council Place 4**
[Notice of Deadline to File an Application for Place on the Ballot](https://sainthedwigcity.com/Notice%20of%20Deadline%20to%20File%20an%20Application%20for%20Place%20on%20the%20Ballot%20(posted%20in%20bulletin%20boards).pdf?t=202512121254540)
*It is the candidate's responsibility
to ensure the required, proper and applicable applications/forms/documents/reports
are completed and filed in a timely manner.
All documents requiring a notary should be notarized before filing with the City.*
[First Steps for Candidates Running for a City Office (1/1/2026) (Texas Ethics Commission, TEC)](https://sainthedwigcity.com/Election,%20May%202,%202025/01_First%20Steps%20for%20Candidates%20Running%20for%20a%20City%20Office%20(1-1-2026)%20(Texas%20Ethics%20Commission,%20TEC).pdf?t=202512151444350)
[Application for a Place on the Ballot](https://sainthedwigcity.com/Election,%20May%202,%202025/02_Application%20for%20a%20Place%20on%20the%20Ballot_Form%202-49,%2007-2025.pdf?t=202512151444530)
[Form CTA, Appointment of Campaign Treasurer (1/1/2026)](https://sainthedwigcity.com/Form%20CTA_Appointment%20of%20a%20Campaign%20Treasurer%20(1-1-2026).pdf?t=202601211759200)
[Form CTA, Instruction Guide (1/1/2026)](https://sainthedwigcity.com/Form%20CTA_Instruction%20Guide%20(1-1-2026).pdf?t=202601211802330)
[Request for Confidentiality of Candidate (09/2025)](https://sainthedwigcity.com/Election,%20May%202,%202025/05_Form%202-67_Request%20for%20Confidentiality%20for%20Candidates%20Under%20Texas%20Government%20Code%20(09-2025).pdf?t=202512151456300)

POLITICAL ADVERTISING
[Political Advertising, What You Need to Know (TEC)](https://sainthedwigcity.com/06a_Political%20Advertising_What%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20(TEC).pdf?t=202401101706500)
[Saint Hedwig Sign Ordinance 2025-03](https://sainthedwigcity.com/2025-03_ORDINANCE_Signs%20(signed)%20AMENDS%20ORD%201706%20&%20REPEALS%20ORD%200511.pdf?t=202601071356340)
[Texas Department of Transportation (TXDOT)\_Campaign Signs](https://www.txdot.gov/business/right-of-way/campaign-signs.html)
[TXDOT\_Political & Campaign Signs\_Frequently Asked Questions](https://sainthedwigcity.com/06b_TXDOT_Political%20Campaign%20Signs%20Frequently%20Asked%20Questions.pdf?t=202401101709170)
THE CITY OF SAINT HEDWIG DOES NOT PROVIDE LEGAL OR CAMPAIGN ADVISE.
For legal or campaign advise, contact the Texas Ethics Commission or the Texas Secretary of State.
Texas Ethics Commission
1-512-463-5800
<https://ethics.state.tx.us/>
Texas Secretary of State
1-800-252-8683
<https://www.sos.state.tx.us/elections/index.shtml>
The City of Saint Hedwig contracts with Bexar County to administer its elections.
Unofficial Election Results are provided by Bexar County Elections Dept. on Election night.
[Bexar County Elections Dept. - Election Results](https://www.bexar.org/2186/Historical-Election-Results)
The City of Saint Hedwig holds its General Election  every year on the first Saturday of May.
Election is held at:
Saint Hedwig City Hall
13065 FM 1346
Saint Hedwig, Texas 78152
210-667-9568
[cityhall@sainthedwigcity.com](mailto:cityhall@sainthedwigcity.com)
The office of Mayor and City Council Place 2 and Place 4
are up for election on even numbered years.
The office of City Council Place 1, Place 3 and Place 5
are up for election on odd numbered years.
All elected officials serve two-year terms.
Candidates must meet the following qualifications per Type A City, Local Gov't Code, Section 22.032,  and other eligibility requirements of the Texas Election Code and Local Government Code.
For Office of Mayor:

* One (1) year in the State of Texas prior to filing deadline and
* One (1) year in the City of Saint Hedwig (within the city limits) prior to election day.

For Office of City Council:

* One (1) year in the State of Texas prior to filing deadline and
* Six (6) months in the City of Saint Hedwig (within the city limits) prior to election day.

Candidate must be minimum 18 years of age.
Candidate must be a registered voter in the territory elected from
by the filing deadline.
First day to file an application for a place on the ballot:
30th day before the filing deadline.
Last day (filing deadline) to file an application for a place on the ballot:
78th day before election day, 5:00 p.m.

* [TEXAS SECRETARY OF STATE - CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS](https://www.sos.state.tx.us/elections/laws/terms.shtml)
* [TEXAS SECRETARY OF STATE - CANDIDATE FILING REQUIREMENTS](https://www.sos.state.tx.us/elections/laws/candidacy.shtml)
* [TEXAS STATUTES - ELECTION CODE & LOCAL GOVERNMENT CODE](https://statutes.capitol.texas.gov/)
